Short but amazing. Great level design, great story, great everything. Buy and play this game.

Portal is a game that is must have for PC. It's very cheap on sale so it doesn't hurt that much if you don't enjoy.

I've always heard great things about this game, so I bought it in the Steam Summer Sale. Going in with high expectations, it was a bit underwhelming. The puzzles are fun, story is fine, atmosphere is oddly eerie. Its a pretty good game, it also allows for community maps and extra maps. So if you're a creative person this game is a must have. 

Overall, while I enjoyed my time with this game. It really isn't that memorable. It's still a very solid game and I don't regret this purchase. 8/10.

Principalmente este juego es una leyenda.

El juego tiene un gameplay super bueno y siendo uno de los pioneros en un concepto original en su tiempo, en graficos actualmente tiene algunos defectos pero sigue siendo muy competente, en banda sonora no es tan recordado solamente por su rola del final que si es recordada y en historia tambien es buen juego con un buen lore detras.

El juego tiene algunos aspectos de rejugabilidad pero este jugeo es excelnte por su apartado de speerun, ya que este juego he comenzado a hacer speedruns y he llegado a saberme muchos trucos que he llegado a terminar el juego en 22 minutos.

Muy recomendado como primer juego para speerun y disfrutable para todas las personas. 9/10

I've played through this game on its own, no achievement hunting or exploring past what you'd go for in a first play, almost 5 times now. The story is fantastic, and it's interesting enough to keep me playing over and over to see what I may have missed. I've played so many times just looking for every little secret and scrap of story, and I still don't think I've found them all. 10/10 game, would recommend.

Hope they make a 3rd game sometime

This is one of my all-time favorite games. GREAT storyline, graphics, conceptual puzzles which get increasingly more complex. TONS of creative behind-the-scenes puzzles (yes, puzzles within puzzles) all while trying to escape a "testing" center. If you've played Portal 2, but never tried this one - same concepts, slightly different storyline and timeline, but all of the great features you grow to adore with Portal 2. I'll admit I play this game for fun OVER and OVER, and never tire of it. One of the few, if any, games that can hold my attention with creative puzzle solving and still go back and do it again, and again, and still find new things I didn't see before. If you HAVEN'T played Portal 2, and you're considering this version first ... I haven't met a single person who's played it and didn't like it, so you might as well grab both of them now. The game gets increasingly more difficult, but not so much that you feel entirely stuck and start loathing the game itself. It's a blast, and very, very addictive. Don't say I didn't warn you. Have fun!

Portal is a classic in my eyes. Basic controls and mechanic are simple: left-click to fire a portal, right click to fire the other. However, Valve took such a simple mechanic and turned it into a full adventure with many unique physics puzzles that each offer unique risks, challenges, and rewards. The atmosphere of the game is beautifully isolating, and the story (not including lore from other games in the franchise) is simple yet compelling.
classic intro into games

What amazes me most about this game is that even after so many years, it still holds up as an excellent, really interesting game, and a favorite of many, myself included. 10/10 will continue to play even when I'm 90 and in a nursing home.
